issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: The problem is a duplicate of an existing issue.
resolution.name: Duplicate

fields.summary: ImportInstance failed to create booting instance on HTTPS-enabled Eucalyptus Cloud

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
I've been unable to import an instance and get a booted connected instance as a result. 
The instance and image created from the import tasks does not appear to actually boot. The VM state does transition to booted but there doesn't appear to be a working image. There is no console output, no network, etc.. 
The same image when imported into a volume, snapshotted and registered creates working VMs, with console output and nework connectivity. 
I've tried on both a VPC and Edge system using the same precise and cirros images for testing. 
I've been unable to get the imaging worker to launch with the ssh key provided in the 
"services.imaging.worker.keyname" property so don't have much information yet. 
Thanks,
-M
fields.summary: Unable to connect to images created with import-instance

comments.body: I've created a volume from an import instance task's snapshot. I've attached this volume and compared the checksums of the first 'image size bytes' and lengths less than the image size to compare to the original image. The checksums do not match.

[~vasya] I think this is similar or dup of EUCA-12253? 

{code}

I'm not sure if the uri in the manifest is a configurable toggle? I don't see any https properties or values for this cloud? ...
